pageTitle: Central line improvement works at east end of the line

title.title: Central line improvement works at east end of the line

texts: Buses will replace trains between Woodford and Epping and between Hainault and Woodford during the following weekends: 8-9 October, 12-13 November, 3-4 December due to station refurbishment works at Loughton, Theydon Bois and Epping, as well as track replacement taking place at Roding Valley.
Customers are advised to allow an extra 30 minutes to complete their journey
Works are part of TfL's 5-year £10bn investment programme and will be undertaken by Metronet Rail BCV.

Three Rail Replacement Bus services will operate:
A: Between Woodford and Epping;
B: Between Epping and Theydon Bois
C: Between Hainault and Woodford
Customers are advised to allow an extra 30 minutes to complete their journey, especially those wishing to make the last train connections.
Passengers travelling from/to the listed stations are advised to use the following routes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eTheydon Bois:\u003c/strong\u003e Travel via Epping","\u003cstrong\u003eStations east of Woodford:\u003c/strong\u003e Rail Replacement bus service","\u003cstrong\u003eBetween Hainault and Woodford:\u003c/strong\u003e Rail Replacement Bus Service","\u003cstrong\u003eGrange Hill:\u003c/strong\u003e Travel via Hainault","\u003cstrong\u003eChigwell/Roding Valley\u003c/strong\u003e : Travel via Woodford"]}

For 24-hour information on public transport in London, please call: 020 7222 1234.

TfL's Realtime pages display live travel information on London's public transport network: www.tfl.gov.uk/realtime
Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route is shown automatically: www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at: www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["TfL is investing £10bn over the next five years to improve and expand London's transport network, over half of that in the Tube","Metronet Rail BCV is responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Bakerloo, Central, Victoria and Waterloo \u0026 City lines","The Central line is the longest line, with 74km (46 miles) serving 49 stations","The longest journey without change on the London Underground can be made on the Central line between West Ruislip and Epping (54.9 km, 34.1 miles)\u003cbr /\u003e"]}
